name: 1,4-diphenylbutane-2,3-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4214
Reason: 1,4-diphenylbutane-2,3-dione has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit is butane, which has a melting point of -10.5 °C. The presence of two phenyl groups increases the melting point due to the additional molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +20 °C for each phenyl group. The dione functional group introduces a carbonyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +10 °C.
